before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jcg3","text":"make sure to have skimmed milk without any fat, because it will make it harder to extract and purify your expressed protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Joseph Shenekji
creator.affiliation: department of biotechnology engineering, faculty of technical engineering, university of Aleppo

affiliations.affiliation: department of biotechnology engineering, faculty of technical engineering, university of Aleppo

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5g3nf","text":"This protocol provides a framework for using skimmed milk as an alternative to IPTG for inducing lacZ operon expression in bacteria. Adjustments may be necessary based on specific experimental conditions or bacterial strains used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4pk5s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"60s1h","text":"the protocol is only a proof of concept, it needs to be enhanced and measured accurately.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94cmo","text":"we do not have a spectrophotometer or turbidity meter, so everything is evaluated visually as a primary method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"euls7","text":"this method uses skimmed milk provided from supermarkets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"2b4p4","text":"i used liquid skimmed milk because it was the only one available, but powdered skimmed milk could work just fine according to references.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"52jfe","text":"Bacterial strain containing the lacZ operon (e.g., E. coli)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f06n8","text":"LB (Luria-Bertani) broth","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cgbk","text":"Skimmed milk powder or liquid","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cjk9","text":"Antibiotics (e.g., ampicillin or kanamycin, as appropriate)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rm22","text":"Incubator","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1llcp","text":"Shaking incubator","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"886f5","text":"Centrifuge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7os7t","text":"Culture flasks","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6uli","text":"Sterile water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1b9td","text":"Bashir, H., Ahmed, N., Khan, M.A., Zafar, A.U., Tahir, S., Khan, M.I., Khan, F. and Husnain, T. (2016), Simple procedure applying lactose induction and one-step purification for high-yield production of rhCIFN. Biotechnology and Applied Biochemistry, 63: 708-714. https://doi.org/10.1002/bab.1426\nKhani, Mohammad-Hosein, and Masoumeh Bagheri. \"Skimmed milk as an alternative for IPTG in induction of recombinant protein expression.\" Protein expression and purification 170 (2020): 105593.    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":433,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":264,"length":32}],"data":{}},{"key":"bg2st","text":"DOI: 10.1016/j.pep.2020.105593","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"2e4vi","text":"Tian, H., Tang, L., Wang, Y. et al. Lactose Induction Increases Production of Recombinant Keratinocyte Growth Factor-2 in Escherichia coli . Int J Pept Res Ther 17, 123–129 (2011). https://doi.org/10.1007/s10989-011-9249-9  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":29,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":122,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":141,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":161,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3cd6j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"26D529F96D5411EF93280A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1002/bab.1426"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"69268B406D5411EFA3E30A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.pep.2020.105593"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"87gup","text":"read the label for the skimmed milk ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct571","text":"it should contain a percentage of carbohydrates (sugars) it is usually 5% for each 100 ml. if you have powdered skimmed milk things are easier, where you can use 1.0% (w/v) of skimmed milk for the induction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":112,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29cfp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c43ue","text":"Preparation of Skimmed Milk Solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9iobv","text":"Dissolve skimmed milk powder in sterile water to create a 5% (w/v) solution.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nte1","text":"Sterilize the solution by autoclaving or filter sterilization.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vhrb","text":"Inoculation of Bacteria","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rp3r","text":"Inoculate a single colony of the bacteria containing the lacZ operon into   of  supplemented with the appropriate antibiotic.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ms40","text":"Incubate overnight at   with shaking ( ).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":22,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ae003","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3febm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nje7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"-250","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6377o","text":"Harvesting Cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rjuc","text":"After the incubation period, centrifuge the culture at   for   at  to pellet the cells.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"78t9u","text":"Discard the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in an appropriate buffer (e.g., PBS or lysis buffer) for further analysis or protein extraction.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v6jk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eidqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55atp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"4.000","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c743b","text":"Subculture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a8opk","text":"1. The next day, dilute the overnight culture 1:100 into fresh LB broth with antibiotics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5smti","text":"2. Incubate   at   with shaking until the OD600 reaches 0.4-0.6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":17,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2td39","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ls9f","text":"Induction with Skimmed Milk","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38dko","text":"Once the culture reaches the desired OD600, add skimmed milk solution to a final concentration of 1% (w/v) if it is powdered, in case it is liquid, put 20 ml of skimmed milk in the microwave and evaporate the water until it gives a sludge of ~1ml, wait for it to cool down then add it to the culture it will give approximately 1% w/v of lactose. ( )","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":347,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ch453","text":"Gently mix the culture to ensure even distribution.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvooh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a0sfa","text":"Incubation Post-Induction","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9og5k","text":"Continue incubating the culture at 30-37°C with shaking for an additional   to  , depending on the desired expression level. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fekj1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":14400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: process of using Skimmed milk instead of IPTG for induction of protein expression
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9me70","text":"final result looked like this ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"939j1","text":"we used IPTG 0.1 M and skimmed milk 1% W/V to induce Lac Z operon to express GFP, and results came according to the image.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fc03j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3s1rn","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1bkj5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dab98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"alt":"","guid":"C758AA336D5511EFA3E30A58A9FEAC02","height":504,"id":497830,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"25lco\",\"text\":\"comparing results of using IPTG in inducing GFP expression in  LacZ plasmid, and skimmed milk culture of the same bacteria and expression. skimmed milk shows better glow visually under uv.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"WhatsApp Image 2024-09-07 at 22.54.10.jpeg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rge8b9vup.jpeg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rgfgb9vup.jpg","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/rgffb9vup.webp","width":444}}}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"djmej","text":"do not touch the skimmed milk after evaporating water in the microwave, it will be extremely hot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
